responses.rationale: The segment describes the mechanism of disease spread, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
Reports numerical data ('23 states', 'confirmed cases') using standard verbs ('shows', 'have confirmed').
Reports numerical data ('35,500 birds') using a standard verb ('confirmed').
The segment reports locations of cases, not primarily prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
Reports an annual production number ('11.7 million turkeys annually') using a standard verb ('raises').
Reports a count ('46 million chickens') and status ('leading egg producer') using standard verbs ('is', 'had').
Reports counts of birds killed ('13 million chickens', '305,000 turkeys') using standard reporting ('having to kill').
Reports counts of birds killed ('22 million birds', '1.8 million', '1.9 million') using standard reporting ('have had to kill', 'including').
Reports counts of farms infected ('two more farms') and birds killed ('5.3 million hens', '88,000 turkeys') using standard verbs ('infected', 'forcing the killing of').
Reports counts ('at least 26 states', 'nearly a year') using standard verbs ('have been found', 'has been circulating').
Reports a numerical metric ('165Â°F') related to safety using standard verbs ('Cooking', 'kills').
Reports numerical corrections ('22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard reporting ('updated to correct').
Reports numerical corrections ('April 5, 2022', '22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard reporting ('updated to correct').
Reports dates ('April 1', 'April 30') and counts ('at least one person', '36 dairy herds') using standard verbs ('confirmed', 'have been confirmed').
Reports a date ('April 25') and a ratio ('one in five') using standard reporting ('announced its finding').
Reports dates ('January 2003', 'March 2024') and a percentage ('56 percent') using standard reporting ('reported', 'were fatal').
